required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Mailers Promoting Mammogram Screening
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Postcard Mailers Enhanced With Behavioral Nudges to Promote Mammogram Screening

brief_summary.textblock: In this evaluation, 3 different versions of mailers promoting annual mammograms are being sent to women on the month of their 50th and 64th birthdays. The researchers hypothesize that the use of behavioral nudges in the mailers should lead to increased uptake in mammogram screening.

detailed_description.textblock:
Mammogram screening for women, starting at age 50, can significantly reduce the risk of complications due to breast cancer. As part of an existing outreach campaign, the health system mails a postcard and small gift (pink socks) to women on the month of their 50th and 64th birthdays to promote annual mammogram screening.
The researchers are evaluating two new versions of the mailers against a standard mailer to see which version leads to greater uptake in mammograms. The new mailers have content that applies behavioral nudge theory - specifically, loss frames and fear appeals - to encourage taking action. One of the two new versions does not include the small gift, to test whether its inclusion or exclusion has any effect on mammogram screening.

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants and providers are not aware of the different mailer versions.

primary_outcome.description: Binary variable indicating whether a mammogram was completed

secondary_outcome.description: Binary variable indicating whether a mammogram was completed (a longer time frame allows for late responses)

secondary_outcome.measure: Primary Care Provider Visits at 6 months (2020)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of visits (proxy for increased preventative health care)

secondary_outcome.measure: Primary Care Provider Visits at 12 months (2020)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of visits (proxy for increased preventative health care)
Number of visits (proxy for increased preventative health care)
Number of visits (proxy for increased preventative health care)
Binary variable indicating whether the recipient was diagnosed with breast cancer
Binary variable indicating whether the recipient was diagnosed with breast cancer
Number of Emergency Department Visits (proxy for increased costly utilization of health system resources)
Number of Emergency Department Visits (proxy for increased costly utilization of health system resources)

other_outcome.description: Binary variable indicating whether a mammogram was completed to be used for exploratory pre-post comparisons

other_outcome.measure: Primary Care Provider Visits at 12 months (2019)
other_outcome.description: Number of visits to be used for exploratory pre-post comparisons (proxy for increased preventative health care)
Binary variable indicating whether the woman was diagnosed with breast cancer
Number of Emergency Department Visits (proxy for increased costly utilization of health system resources)

arm_group.description: A postcard encourages mammograms and includes a small gift.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Mailer with Loss Frame, Risks, and Small Gift
arm_group.description: The postcard is enhanced with language that further emphasizes the risks but also clearly describes how early detection with a test can reduce those risks; a small gift is included.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Mailer with Loss Frame, Risks, and No Gift
arm_group.description: The postcard is enhanced with language that further emphasizes the risks but also clearly describes how early detection with a test can reduce those risks; the small gift is not included.

intervention.description: The postcard includes appeals to get annual mammograms and provides information for ordering a mammogram.
intervention.arm_group_label: Mailer with Loss Frame, Risks, and No Gift
Mailer with Loss Frame, Risks, and Small Gift

intervention.description: Pink socks are included in the mailer. The gift increases salience of the mailer and it potentially promotes reciprocation from the recipient in the form of ordering a mammogram.
intervention.arm_group_label: Mailer with Loss Frame, Risks, and Small Gift

intervention.description: The postcard is enhanced with language that frames the situation in terms of losses. It also uses fear appeals by stating the risks of breast cancer, while also stating that a mammogram screening is an accessible way to address those risks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Mailer with Loss Frame, Risks, and No Gift
Mailer with Loss Frame, Risks, and Small Gift

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female Geisinger Health Plan members turning 50 and 64 in that month
- For the 2020 campaign, birthdays from June 2020 (as opposed to August 2020) will be included due to a temporary suspension of the outreach program due to the COVID-19 pandemic since June
- For the pre-post examination of the 2019 campaign, all months in that year will be included
Exclusion Criteria:
- Members who are on the do not contact list at Geisinger Health Plan

patient_data.ipd_description: Data with no personally identifiable information will be made available to other researchers on the Open Science Framework for transparency. This will include the essential data and code needed to replicate the analysis that yielded reported findings. The PI did not examine or analyze any data from this study prior to this registration.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: The data will become available after publication of study results in a scientific journal and will be available as long as the Open Science Framework hosts the data.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The data on the Open Science Framework will be open to anyone requesting that information.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
